content.description: long arching splitter crack on slick stone leading into an obvious corner
throwing from a two finger crimp to a huge jug(5ft.)
almost vertical splitter crack up face with no other features

the crux for me is topping out ,you come out of a corner crack onto a mossy ledge where you rap off. A second run above this huge ledge has been added, going through  big slot with one hanger to get you through. When you get to the next ledge, that will be behind you, step over and scramble up to a set of rap anchors. By this time you are above the canopy. Great view!
The crux is at the place where the crack goes left a little. Not a bad crack to warm up on.  The crack is covered with green moss.
content.location: On the right before you get to Father and Son, rap off tree.

content.description: Very clean hand size crack, solid pro. At the small boulder at the top go left and beware of loose rock on top. At the top under an overhang,scramble right to the top of the overhang rap off tree.
content.location: when following the cliff line look for an obvious hand size crack on a ledge on the right.

content.description: follow obvious corner crack until it starts sweeping right to a ledge,fire straight up at this point through a blank section then left to the topout.great route
content.protection: light rack,wedges,slings,4 quickdraws and mid size cams

content.description: Nice boulder, top out is slopey! Start on a horizontal down low and rock up right to another crack and to obvious holds near top.Crux at the top. Easy climb down back side.
content.protection: Crash pad and a good spotter.
content.location: On the trail below Arrow Head boulder.

content.description: Crux is the top. Careful going over the top, steep on the back side (exit the back side of boulder). Note: This is a high ball!
content.protection: Several crash pads and a very good spotter, maybe two. Slightly overhanging!
content.location: Go through the eye of the needle and go down towards the creek and you will see this huge arrowhead-shaped boulder. The problem goes up the center, exit off the backside (careful, the backside is steep).

content.description: Beautiful 100 ft. gray wall,Crux is changing from the right arching hands to fingers crack, to transitioning into the smooth arete.
content.protection: Small pro/light rack. One lost arrow before the crux and one hanger before the top anchors. A couple of draws.
content.location: Around the corner from Father And Son. A large grey wall.

content.description: Really good rock quality, pretty secluded, shaded in the evenings.  Nice area, really pretty.Theres so much virgin rock, with most 80-100 feet. If you like really moderate to stout trad, check it out!
